p: Experimental animals were housed in groups of three and six maintained under a controlled room temperature (22 ± 2 °C) with a constant humidity (55 ± 5 %), ventilation, no noise, and light (12 h light/12 h dark) cycles. Every day, they were fed with pellets (standard diet) produced by Alema Farms PLC (Bishoftu, Ethiopia), and had access to tap water ad libitum. They were acclimatized to standard laboratory conditions (in plastic cages with stainless steel top) for seven days prior to the experiment. Toxicity assays were conducted in accordance with the standard guidelines of the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development (OECD, 2001) for use of animals in scientific research. That is, animal experiments were conducted in compliance with the ARRIVE guidelines for the care and use of laboratory animals in scientific research. It was also carried out in accordance with the U.K. Animals (Scientific Procedures) Act, 1986 and associated guidelines, EU Directive 2010/63/EU for animal experiments.
